page.title: 06Farming, Then and Now
page.content: Since 1945 there have been very striking changes in the farming pattern in this area. Most farms remain the same size though two of them, Killiserth and Trewaters,are farmed in conjunction with others. The chages are in th use made of the land and of the houses situated there. There is now very little dairy farming, instead th farmers find beef nd sheep rearing and corn growing more profitable enterprises requiring much less labour. The work is done with a small team using tractor-driven, electrically-operated machinery. Horses are no longer needed and on most farms there are no poultry and no pigs. Farm cottages have become superfluous so they have been sold and modernised to provide attractive homes. Each farm still has its own independent water supply
